channel.title: Computer brands
channel.description:
I have been looking to invest in a new gaming computer, I bought a new laptop about 6 months ago and im already tired of having a laptop, before you think im spoiled I work a job 5 days a week and I pay for all my stuff myself so no im not spending my parents money. Orignially i was looking at ibuypower but after reading WAY too many bad reviews I changed my mind. I am now looking at cyberpower any thoughts on this brand? Any ideas on any other good gaming PC brands? I would prefer if I could customize the computer myself but if not I can always order a new graphics card etc.. Basically I just want to know what you guys would reccomend as a gaming pc brand (please not alienware) I am not getting alienware because I would like to get AMDs 3.6ghz 8 core processor and alienware does not offer that :P and they are just overpriced. Im trying to stay around 1000$ and on cyberpower i customized a computer with everything I wanted for just over that. I also went to newegg and added parts to my cart that are basically the exact same and it cost me like 150$ more so that is more then likely out of the question. Thanks for any help posted.
If this is the wrong section please just move it.

item.title: Computer brands
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Travas:

I heard Corsair was pretty decent. Did it not have enough power for you or something?

I’m not sure. I think the Corsiar was 430W… I’m running like a 500/550W atm… It just crapped out one day. It happens.

item.title: Computer brands
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“Classic, post:25, topic:464346”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=568262.msg4127015#msg4127015 date=1350577460]

Get Vista. Best gaming computer, it’s so fast… JUST KIDDING… It sucks… My stupid laptop was Vista, it was slow, glitchy, even the task manger was always not resounding… No games would hardly work, all the free space I had on it was like 6gb out of a 27.9gb hard drive. It recently broke cause the internet wouldn’t connect… Even if the cord was plugged up… Stay away from Vista…

Don’t blame the operating system when it’s most likely due to a lack of computer care or hardware malfunctions.

OT: Build your own.
[/quote]
you’re half right and half wrong, yeah he had a bad laptop, but vista is still a bad operating system

also: you probably don’t know how to build your own, so i dont think the average moparscaper would know how either[/quote]
I’m running on my build right now though

NZXT Mid-tower case, AMD Phenom II quad core, integrated graphics, cd drive out of a computer in the attic lol, forgot what power supply I’m using right now… My Corsair blew.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer brands
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“Tutorial, post:20, topic:464346”][quote author=Jmood link=topic=568262.msg4127904#msg4127904 date=1350695819]
AMD will sooner or later figure out that it cannot compete with Intel for processors. If only Intel and Nvidia were on better terms they could merge and then completely take out AMD.
[/quote]
Nvidia doesn’t make processors.[/quote]

I didn’t say Nvidia made a cpu… They do in fact make a processor last I checked it’s called a graphics processing unit. As to my post what I mean is AMD took over ATI, Intel only has it’s integrated graphics which cannot compare to well to Nvidia or AMD.

item.title: Computer brands
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

Bowser jr:

FUCK brands, they are all the same on the inside. Look at the performance of the components.

False, there’s a big difference between brands.
ASUS manufactures a lot of components and base software themselves which gives you a better quality and guarantee than e.g. an acer that buys everything from all different companies which also makes it more expensive.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer brands
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

amd is way behind intel, so leave that.
an i5 should do it as long you don’t feel like running 5 games of skyrim and max payne3 at the same time you don’t need an i7
get at least 12GB ram preferably 16, 8 is basically for normal computers these days. If you buy lower your seriously ripped off.
Get an SSD for your boot and heaviest games, ddr3 for all the rest. This is mostly the bottleneck of your system so don’t mind spending some more on an SSD, SSD is the future.
and a nvidia 550-650 should be more than enough, I have 540 and can run every game on ultra.
If you don’t want to build your own, get an ASUS. They are the best no discussion.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer brands
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

why would I say what? it’s well known games are horrible to catch up, many games are only just releasing 4 core support, it’ll be a long time before those extra 8 cores would be supported

and as for being a hindrance, those 8 core cpus are much better for server work where all the cores and functions can be utilised, there’s much better desktop chips available

Read full topic
